book.book_title: THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE EPHESIANS
book.title: Greeting
Praise to God for Spiritual Blessings
book.note: A number of the earliest and most important manuscripts omit "in Ephesus," though it is hard to make sense of the line without this phrase (cf. RSV, "to the saints who are also faithful")
Or "before him, having predestined us in love" (the phrase "in love" could go either with v. 4 or v. 5)
book.title: Prayer for Spiritual Wisdom
Made Alive in Christ
book.note: This phrase is a Semitic idiom which can mean either (1) "children characterized by wrath" or (2) "children destined for wrath"
book.title: Jewish and Gentile Believers United in Christ
book.note: Or "are built up together in spirit [ = spiritually] into a dwelling place of God" (cf. NRSV)
book.title: The Mystery of Christ Revealed
book.note: Some manuscripts have "given to me for you, that according to"
book.title: Prayer for Spiritual Strength
Christians Should Live in Unity
Gifted Leaders Bring the Church to Maturity
Appeal for New Behavior
Old Behavior, New Behavior, and Motivation
book.note: Lit. "Every rotten word must not proceed"
book.title: Imitators of God
Walk Like Children of Light
Being Filled by the Spirit
book.note: A quotation of unknown origin with possible allusions to Isa 26:19, 51:17, 52:1, 60:1
book.title: Husbands and Wives
Children and Parents
book.note: A quotation from Exod 20:12 and/or Deut 5:16
book.title: Slaves and Masters
Spiritual Warfare
book.note: Some manuscripts have "if he should do anything good"
book.title: Conclusion and Benediction
book.note: Lit. "in it" since "chain" is singular in the Greek text
